question: What does the Drain (DRN) boundary condition simulate in a groundwater model? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Correct. DRN boundaries simulate outflow points that discharge only when the aquifer head is above the drain elevation.
error: ❌ Not quite. A DRN boundary discharges groundwater and has a flow cutoff at the drain elevation.

question: Under which condition does a DRN boundary stop discharging water? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Yes. The flow stops when aquifer head is below or equal to the drain elevation, or if conductance is zero.
error: ❌ Rethink. Flow is zero when aquifer head is at or below the drain elevation, or conductance is zero.

question: What distinguishes the DRN boundary from the General Head Boundary (GHB)? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Well done. DRN boundaries are one-directional with a cutoff. GHBs are fully head-dependent and bidirectional.
error: ❌ Not quite. DRNs differ from GHBs in directionality and behavior below cutoff elevation.

question: Which of the following is required to define a DRN boundary? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Correct. DRNs require elevation, aquifer head, and conductance — not recharge.
error: ❌ Review needed. Recharge is not a direct input to DRN boundaries.
